column4: yes i have a problem with installing amule, can anyone help me?
if you tell us what the problem is we might try to help
excellent suggestion, but you see this is like my first day, so i just have a bunch of files waiting in a folder to be installed
It seems that you downloaded amule source. Why dont you install it through synaptic?
excellent suggestion, got a link to a howto for me :D
pate to #flood ot ubuntu.pastebin.com net time please
it seems that you have non ubuntu repositories in your sources.list file. can you paste it as well?
should i remove the repos that i have added
read the link ubotu sent you and make your sources.list like these. amule is in the universe repository
if that was your *whole* sources.list file it means that you have disabled all ubuntu repositories. No security updates, no nothing.
read the synaptic wiki as well if you haven't read it already
ty man, succesful installation, your like a noobs god
hah, I didn't write those wikis you know :-)
